messages.message:
A really cool demo from Hamish here:
https://www.linkedin.com/posts/ben-wood-a2b582151_genai-documents-instabase-activity-[â€¦]271985987584-igo4?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop (https://www.linkedin.com/posts/ben-wood-a2b582151_genai-documents-instabase-activity-7189581271985987584-igo4?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop)

As you can see in this demo, location tracking is a bit 'wobbly' for list of objects fields. Is it possible to turn this off for now? or draw a larger more general bounding box like we do for reasoning queries?
Being able to turn off location tracking would be incredibly useful for demos (in cases where you know it struggles in advance)
cc @Vishnu for the provenance for list of objects fields

i agree that turning provenance on/off in the UI would be helpful! can you create an EPD ticket?

cc @Kaustubh (KD)
Okay got it! Yeah the source tracking (I think this is what our docs use) should totally be configurable
btw @Hamish @Matt Weaver do you see possible scenarios where you'd want confidence turned off? it does add latency and cost to extraction as there are additional llm calls.
